issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We have the below message on the NC filling the disk (it's at 10G). We trace the activity of one of such volumes, and we saw the attachment, and the detachment, on both NC and CC with no error whatsoever. 

The use case here is to create a volume from a snapshot, attach it to the running instance, test some code, detach volume, destroy volume, rinse and repeat.

{code}  
I/O warning : failed to load external entity "/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/QOLXW8R4YCSKWUBNO2HLK/i-C2963DD6/vol-60573D14-libvirt.xml"

comments.body: These contain the contents of /var/log/libvirt from our two NCs.
this shows how approximately how much output it's producing
here are the virsh dumpxml i-XXXXXX outputs for all of the instances we have running on each NC

For the

pstack <pid>

Do you want me to run this on the NC, or on the CC?  Is it the httpd process, or a different one?  Can I find it with something like "ps aux | grep [...]" ?

{code}
[root@smeuca02 ~]# ps aux | grep http[d]
root      7247  0.0  0.0  54868  1432 ?        Ss   May24   1:07 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //etc/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf
498       7249  2.9  0.1 1762360 361056 ?      Sl   May24 896:52 /usr/sbin/httpd -f //etc/eucalyptus/httpd-nc.conf
[root@smeuca02 ~]# pstack 
Usage: pstack <process-id>
[root@smeuca02 ~]# pstack 7247
#0  0x00007fccd69da4d3 in __select_nocancel () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007fccd6ecc125 in apr_sleep () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0
#2  0x00007fccd83f2ca9 in ap_wait_or_timeout ()
#3  0x00007fccd83fd167 in ap_mpm_run ()
#4  0x00007fccd83d4900 in main ()
[root@smeuca02 ~]# pstack 7249
Thread 3 (Thread 0x7fccc19a2700 (LWP 7256)):
#0  0x00007fccd69a5b8d in nanosleep () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007fccd69dad64 in usleep () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#2  0x00007fccd0763165 in ?? () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#3  0x00007fccd0763876 in ?? () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#4  0x00007fccd6c93851 in start_thread () from /lib64/libpthread.so.0
#5  0x00007fccd69e190d in clone () from /lib64/libc.so.6
Thread 2 (Thread 0x7fccc0fa1700 (LWP 7267)):
#0  0x00007fccd69a5b8d in nanosleep () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007fccd69a5a00 in sleep () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#2  0x00007fccd071b1b1 in monitoring_thread () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so
#3  0x00007fccd6c93851 in start_thread () from /lib64/libpthread.so.0
#4  0x00007fccd69e190d in clone () from /lib64/libc.so.6
Thread 1 (Thread 0x7fccd83a67e0 (LWP 7249)):
#0  0x00007fccd69e3c3f in accept4 () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007fccd6ec4e8a in apr_socket_accept () from /usr/lib64/axis2c/lib/libapr-1.so.0
#2  0x00007fccd83fdbe1 in unixd_accept ()
#3  0x00007fccd83fc913 in ?? ()
#4  0x00007fccd83fcc8a in ?? ()
#5  0x00007fccd83fd90c in ap_mpm_run ()
#6  0x00007fccd83d4900 in main ()
[root@smeuca02 ~]# 

{code}
We aren't seeing this bug in 3.3.0.
[~kedwards] I think this should be close: do we know why this got fix into 3.3.0?

I do not recall seeing a ticket for this. So, either it was fixed unintentionally, along with other changes, or the bug is still there and is no longer exhibiting itself for some reason. Let's close for now and will reopen if anyone sees this again.
Issues marked fixed in currently released versions of the software. Moving to Closed fixed
